intro: Maytenus gracilipes subsp. arguta, commonly known as the slender mayten, is a species of flowering plant in the family Phyllantaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is a small to medium-sized shrub or tree, characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, greenish-white flowers. It produces small, fleshy berries that are typically eaten by birds and other animals. The subspecies arguta is distinguished by its slightly hooked leaves and is often found in humid, lowland forests.
